items.question: What is one advantage of using comprehensions over explicit loops in Python?
choices: Comprehensions are easier to debug
Comprehensions are compiled to efficient bytecode
Comprehensions allow for more complex conditional logic
Comprehensions can handle side effects better

items.question: When should generator expressions be preferred over list comprehensions in Python?
choices: When memory efficiency is important and not all results need to be stored
When immediate evaluation of all results is necessary
When dealing with small datasets
When the order of elements is crucial

items.question: What is a recommended guideline for improving readability in Python comprehensions?
choices: Use comprehensions for side effects to reduce boilerplate code
Avoid giving meaningful variable names to keep the code concise
Break long comprehensions across multiple lines for readability
Use comprehensions for deeply nested logic to maintain brevity

items.question: What is the primary advantage of using comprehensions over explicit loops in Python?
choices: Faster execution speed
Clearer intent
Less memory usage
Easier error handling

items.question: When should nested comprehensions in Python be avoided?
choices: When they increase code conciseness
When they involve multiple for-clauses
When they become hard to understand
When they are used for filtering
